doc:
William Como https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Como 0 William "Bill" Como (November 10, 1925 – January 1, 1989) was the editor-in-chief of Dance Magazine during the period of 1970–1988, when it was "the publication of record", crucial for linking many developments in dance into "a dance world", through culturally-burgeoning decades that rank among the most important theater-arts epochs of the twentieth century. William_"_Bill_"_Como ( November_10_,_1925 – January_1_,_1989 ) was the_editor-in-chief of Dance_Magazine during the_period of 1970 – 1988 , when it was " the_publication of record " , crucial for linking many_developments in dance into " a_dance_world_" , through culturally-burgeoning_decades that rank among the_most_important_theater-arts_epochs of the_twentieth_century .
